result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro J Torres Acosta

defendant.name: Torres Acosta, Pedro J
defendant.address: 7920 South Wildwood Drive #3, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta appeared by video.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Pedro J Torres Acosta.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Sarah Chwaszczewski sworn. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta appeared by video.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Pedro J Torres Acosta.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel recently received an offer and is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta in court.  Attorney Awni M Yasin in court for Pedro J Torres Acosta. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court waived Spanish interpreter appearance. Defense in receipt of discovery but not an offer. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court is in receipt of defense request for Substitution of Judge  Court consented to substitution against Judge  Watts ( Post-Rotation).     
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards Branch 30. 
Court ordered matter transferred and adjourned to Branch 30. Pretrial Conference scheduled August 25, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status of Counsel. Court waived interpreter appearance for todays proceedings. Attorney Yasin accepts the court appointment and request a pretrial date.  
Parties advised Effective July 30, 2022 this case will be reassigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15, Room 623.

Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  interpreter sworn: Liesl Monroy. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference/ status of counsel.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Awni Yasin  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin  30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with IEF.

Defendant Pedro J Torres Acosta in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@1p
